tasks.task: Conduct a survey to identify and inventory management practices for dairy farm manure handling.
subtasks: Collect online survey responses from Wisconsin dairy farms of various sizes.
Divide survey respondents into four farm size groups: small (1-99 animal units), medium (100-199), large (200-999), and permanent (1,000+).
Analyze the types of manure handling practices (excretion, collection, transportation, storage, land application) for each farm size group.
Examine energy consumption practices related to manure handling systems.

tasks.task: Develop a life cycle assessment model to quantify greenhouse gas emissions from manure management practices.
subtasks: Utilize ISM model equations for methane and nitrous oxide emissions.
Adapt survey data for energy consumption in calculations.
Model nine scenario variations to compare greenhouse gas emissions under reference, low, and high emission conditions.

tasks.task: Analyze survey results and model outputs for greenhouse gas and ammonia emissions.
subtasks: Compare manure management practices among different farm size groups.
Evaluate the impact of manure type, collection methods, transportation distances, storage practices, processing, and land application techniques on emissions.
Assess the contribution of each management practice to overall greenhouse gas emissions.
Identify key strategies for reducing greenhouse gas and ammonia emissions in dairy farms.
